I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mallâ€”and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access â€“ no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recentlyâ€”and how close are our retail properties to catching up? This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mallâ€”and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access â€“ no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recentlyâ€”and how close are our retail properties to catching up? ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates â€“ April 7, 2025 ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ªStay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1ï¸âƒ£ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals â€¢	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of â‚¬750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. â€¢	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. â€¢	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.â¸»hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates â€“ April 7, 2025 ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ªStay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1ï¸âƒ£ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals â€¢	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of â‚¬750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. â€¢	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. â€¢	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.â¸»hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

'Dubai is a bubble'Not even close.Aa per theÂ UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, Dubai is classified asÂ fair value. The growth in Dubai is a master plan, backed by real fundamentals:=> Population and business expansion=> Higher NET yields than nearly every major city => Investor friendly regulations=> Tax free income and 100% foreign ownershipThis isn't a hype driven surge; it's a maturing, global market offering solid tax free returns.(photo from UBS global bubble index)Full article here:https://lnkd.in/d-y8zUr7hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#UBSBubbleIndex hashtag#InvestmentInsights hashtag#PropertyMarket hashtag#CommercialRealEstate

He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mallâ€”and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recentlyâ€”and how close are our retail properties to catching up? This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

I just walked into the future of retail. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access â€“ no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates â€“ April 7, 2025 ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ªStay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1ï¸âƒ£ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals â€¢	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of â‚¬750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. â€¢	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. â€¢	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.â¸»hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

'Dubai is a bubble'Not even close.Aa per theÂ UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, Dubai is classified asÂ fair value. The growth in Dubai is a master plan, backed by real fundamentals:=> Population and business expansion=> Higher NET yields than nearly every major city => Investor friendly regulations=> Tax free income and 100% foreign ownershipThis isn't a hype driven surge; it's a maturing, global market offering solid tax free returns.(photo from UBS global bubble index)Full article here:https://lnkd.in/d-y8zUr7hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#UBSBubbleIndex hashtag#InvestmentInsights hashtag#PropertyMarket hashtag#CommercialRealEstate

He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mallâ€”and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recentlyâ€”and how close are our retail properties to catching up? This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

I just walked into the future of retail. It is a reimagined retail environment built for speed, data, and human experience.What stood out to me:Biometric/ FastPass access â€“ no phones, no queues. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ª UAE Governance Regulatory and Policy Updates â€“ April 7, 2025 ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ªStay informed about the latest regulatory developments affecting businesses in the UAE.1ï¸âƒ£ Implementation of 15% Minimum Top-Up Tax on Large Multinationals â€¢	Update: Effective January 1, 2025, the UAE will impose a Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (DMTT) of 15% on large multinational enterprises (MNEs) with consolidated global revenues of â‚¬750 million or more in at least two of the four preceding financial years. This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. This positions the UAE as the top-ranked country in the world for fibre-optic connectivity since 2016.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Infrastructure Utilization: Leverage the advanced fibre-optic infrastructure to enhance digital operations and services. â€¢	Competitive Advantage: Explore opportunities for innovation and improved customer experiences enabled by high-speed connectivity. â€¢	IT Strategy: Align IT strategies to capitalize on the robust digital infrastructure for future growth.â¸»hashtag#UAECompliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#GovernanceExcellence hashtag#UAEGovernment hashtag#CorporateGovernance

'Dubai is a bubble'Not even close.Aa per theÂ UBS Global Real Estate Bubble Index, Dubai is classified asÂ fair value. The growth in Dubai is a master plan, backed by real fundamentals:=> Population and business expansion=> Higher NET yields than nearly every major city => Investor friendly regulations=> Tax free income and 100% foreign ownershipThis isn't a hype driven surge; it's a maturing, global market offering solid tax free returns.(photo from UBS global bubble index)Full article here:https://lnkd.in/d-y8zUr7hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#UBSBubbleIndex hashtag#InvestmentInsights hashtag#PropertyMarket hashtag#CommercialRealEstate

He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. In this role, Mr. Dakheel will oversee all investment-related activities and portfolio management.With over 25 years of experience in strategic investment and asset management, Mr. Dakheel has held leadership positions in a number of companies and institutions across various sectors. His expertise extends to strategic investment and asset management, private equity investment, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate finance across the Middle East and North Africa region. He possesses in-depth knowledge in evaluating business and investment opportunities, developing strategic and operational plans, investment valuation experience, and analyzing and modeling financial information.

This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%. I just walked into the future of retail. Literally.Yesterday, I visited the e& Store (EASE) at Dubai Mallâ€”and it is unlike anything I have seen in the GCC retail landscape.This is not just a digital twist on a telecom store. Just walk in.AI-powered smart shelving & autonomous checkout â€“ zero friction.Trade-in machines â€“ seamless upgrade path, no human needed.Facial recognition SIM activation â€“ onboard tourists in seconds.Self-assisted purchase & delivery stations â€“ shop here, receive anywhere.Deep digital integration â€“ loyalty, payments, and analytics in one loop.As someone who helps reshaping retail assets within the region, I see this as a clear benchmark. It signals where the region is headed: From transactional to experiential. From staffed to autonomous. From square meters to smart meters.Big respect to e& UAE for raising the bar.What are the most futuristic retail formats you have experienced recentlyâ€”and how close are our retail properties to catching up? This aligns with the OECDâ€™s global minimum corporate tax agreement.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Financial Assessment: Evaluate your companyâ€™s global revenue to determine if the DMTT applies. â€¢	Tax Planning: Consult with tax advisors to understand the implications and ensure compliance with the new tax requirements.  â€¢	Compliance Measures: Update internal accounting systems to accurately calculate and report the DMTT. 2ï¸âƒ£ Abu Dhabiâ€™s Measures to Simplify Business Registration â€¢	Update: On December 4, 2024, Abu Dhabi announced the establishment of the Abu Dhabi Registration Authority (ADRA) to centralize and streamline business registration processes. This initiative aims to attract foreign investment and support economic diversification efforts.  â€¢	Action Required: â€¢	Process Review: Familiarize your team with the new registration procedures introduced by ADRA. â€¢	Engagement: Engage with ADRA to ensure a smooth transition and compliance with updated requirements. â€¢	Strategic Planning: Consider the benefits of the streamlined processes for potential business expansion or new ventures in Abu Dhabi.3ï¸âƒ£ UAE Ranks First Globally in Fibre-to-Home Coverage â€¢	Update: As of April 7, 2025, the UAE achieved a global record in fibre-to-the-home network coverage, reaching 99.5%.
